jobPostingInfo.title: Education Program Coordinator 1
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Position Overview

The chosen candidate will serve as Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Accessibility (DEIA) internships program coordinator in JPL’s Education Office, and will coordinate prospective mentor announcements of opportunity, student recruitment and application, student selection, onboarding processes and enrichment activities.  The work requires direct interactions with students, mentors and their business support staff under the supervision of the Education Office DEIA Program Manager to submit, edit, and approve Announcements of Opportunity (AOs), answer process and opportunity related questions. Reporting aspects include i) creation of spreadsheets and/or development of custom databases pertaining to project needs, ii) preparation of surveys and collection important data associated with project metrics, iii) preparation, submission, and tracking of Subcontract Activity Orders (SAOs) and Education Office Internal Payroll (EOIP) entries for student internships, iv) working with support staff to facilitate a seamless onboarding of interns, v) assisting with the planning and execution of summer student internship activities and events, vi) participation in student orientation meetings, vii) enhancing and/or automating current business functions for student programs, viii) and arranging in person appointments and online meetings for JPL and external educational partners.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Serve as a program coordinator to assist Education Office DEIA Program Manager with the coordination of the DEIA internships.
  • Administer and support activities for underserved and underrepresented populations, based on research, teaching and learning methodologies, tools, and environments
  • Help increase and enable a diverse STEM student pipeline at JPL. In particular, support efforts to increase the number of underserved and underrepresented undergraduates in STEM.
  • Gather and submit data on program activities and events to the appropriate JPL reporting systems, and in response to the data requests regarding Minority-Serving Institutions (MSIs).
  • Assist in the development of materials, online tools, services, products, etc. that advance the Laboratory education mission and comply with NASA and industry standards.
  • Assist in developing guidelines for working with students, faculty, researchers, mentors, and schools/academic institutions
  • Support and participate in improving and/or revising procedures and processes internal to the organization  

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in education, business or related fields with a minimum of 1 years of related experience; Master’s degree in education, business or related fields with a minimum of 0 years of related experience
  • Proven ability to research, gather information, and recommend solutions to fit the strategic vision and organizational needs
  • Ability to develop and maintain a project plan for all aspects of assigned projects
  • Proficient in the use of MS Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; project management application experience is a plus
  • Passion and experience for creating positive change around diversity, equity, and inclusion
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and bring resources together to implement solutions and enact change; within the framework of ongoing activities within JPL
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written required.
  • Excellent time management skills, the ability to coordinate multiple projects at once and work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Proven ability to exercise independent judgement, discretion and confidentiality
  • Ability to develop solid relationships and collaboration skills at all levels of the organization
  • Familiarity with program administration experiences at HBCUs/MSIs, or, wide-ranging experiences in collaborative academic, research and development programs.
  • Familiarity with the mission and practices of Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs), Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSIs), Tribal Colleges and Universities (TCUs), and other Minority-Serving institutions (MSIs); and familiarity with legislative and congressional mandates regarding these institutions

Preferred Qualifications:

  • General knowledge of JPL and NASA education programs. 
  • Ability to effectively communicate with student populations via social media tools such as Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, Slack, etc.
  • Awareness of key market industry trends, best practices, and taking ideas to reality within a business environment, is a plus
  • Experience in student programs, with a strong knowledge of policies, procedures, and the legal landscape related to DEIA efforts, is a plus

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
